section.name: Getting Involved with Apache Tuscany
section.p:
You can get involved in Apache Tuscany in many different ways. The following are a few suggestions:
Contribute new ideas/requirements that are based on real business experiences to the mailing list to improve Tuscany as a solution for SOA.
Answer questions posted to the mailing lists.
Contribute to the FAQ or to linkNewWindow('http://wiki.apache.org/ws/Tuscany','Wiki');
Contribute to user or developer Documentations.
Investigate linkNewWindow('http://issues.apache.org/jira/secure/BrowseProject.jspa?id=12310210','issues'); that have been reported and provide patches.
Help with development. Check for roadmap on the Wiki.
Help with linkNewWindow('samples/java/GettingStarted.htm','Tuscany Samples'); to demonstrate Tuscany's value and help new users understand Tuscany

Before you start, join Tuscany mailing list. At the moment we only have one mailing list that handles both developer and user questions.
Subscription: Send a blank email to tuscany-dev-subscribe@ws.apache.org
Posting questions to the list: Send your question to tuscany-dev@ws.apache.org
You should also review linkNewWindow('http://www.apache.org/foundation/how-it-works.html','How Apache works');.

section.name: How to get involved
section.p:
Apache Tuscany source code, documentation and web site are managed under version control using Subversion in linkNewWindow('https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/tuscany','Tuscany Subversion Repository');. In this repository structure you will find two main directories
CPP directory holds SCA and SDO C++ source code.
Java directory holds SCA, SDO and DAS source code.
We welcome your help with any of the sub projects. You can learn more about how to setup your development environment on Java project page or C++ project page.
